definition: food preserved in sugar or honey

sentences.english: Vacuum continuous soakage on sweetmeat is grand reformation of sweetmeat processing.
sentences.chinese: 蜜餞的真空連續浸漬是蜜餞加工工藝的重大革新。

sentences.english: Vacuum continuous soakage on sweetmeat is grand reformation of sweetmeat processing.
sentences.chinese: 蜜餞的真空連續浸漬是蜜餞加工工藝的重大革新。

sentences.english: Mother puts up a keeping [store] of preserved fruits and jellies every year.
sentences.chinese: 母親每年都要貯存蜜餞和果凍。

sentences.english: There are several basic ways to conserve chiller plant energy.
sentences.chinese: 對蜜餞冷鐵有一些基本方法廠能源。
母親做了一些蜜餞洋李。

sentences.english: Marshmallows may also be added on top for flavor and decoration.
sentences.chinese: 也有可能加入葵蜜餞粉在表面作爲裝飾並且增加風味。

sentences.english: Seeberger is one of the few high quality dried fruit and preserves available in the international market.
sentences.chinese: 國際市場上高質量的乾果和蜜餞不很多見。

sentences.english: The processing technology for low-sugar preserved kidney bean was studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了低糖芸豆蜜餞生產工藝。

sentences.english: To establish the method of determination of dulcin in succade by HPLC.
sentences.chinese: 建立蜜餞食品中甘素的測定方法。

sentences.english: I was surprised to find that the strong man liked to eat conserves.
sentences.chinese: 我很驚奇地發現這個強壯的男人喜歡喫蜜餞。

sentences.english: They candy fruit in autumn every year.
sentences.chinese: 他們每年秋天都做蜜餞水果。

sentences.english: A bean in liberty is better than a comfit in prison.
sentences.chinese: 寧在自由中喫豆瓣，不在囚牢中享蜜餞。

sentences.english: I was surprised to find that the strong man liked to eat conserves.
sentences.chinese: 我很驚訝地發現這個強壯的男人喜歡喫蜜餞。

sentences.english: Add an equal quantity of preserving sugar and stir over a low to medium heat until it has dissolved.
sentences.chinese: 加入等量的蜜餞糖，用低中火烹飪，直到溶解。

sentences.english: Breadfruit is also candied, or sometimes prepared as a sweet pickle.
sentences.chinese: 亦可做成糖或者有時會醃製成蜜餞。

definition: tanghulu/candied fruits on bamboo skewers dipped in sugar syrup, a common Chinese snack
soft candy (gummi candy, gumdrop, jellybean etc)
macaron, French pastry with a soft filling sandwiched between the meringue-based cookie shells (loanword)
red pitaya/dragon fruit/dragon pearl fruit (genus Hylocereus)
